title: Cannot Import Events into Calendar
content:
Recently I was unable to SEND invites to anyone, but I fixed that. My e-mail address had disappeared from the "edit calendar" window, who knows why that happened, I have added it back.

Now I can send invites to others including a second email account of mine, the ICS files arrive but when opened the "Import Event" button does nothing.

Everything was normal until a week or so ago, then something broke or maybe there was an update that had a bug in it?

Any suggestions for a fix?

title: Emails on External Hard Drive but Folders Only
content:
Hi there,

I saved my Thunderbird emails (downloaded via POP) onto an external hard drive, folders only. I did not save the profile portion but I know what it is as I have a screenshot of it. Can it be used in my Thunderbird Mail profile that I currently have?

Is there a way to import these POP folders from the external drive onto my iMac (Ventura)? There are almost 95K emails to import.

Can steps be provided so that I can access these emails, please? I have a new Thunderbird profile that I can use.

Thank you.

Lynn
creator: Injebreck1

title: Firefox and Thunderbird have "Invalid Profiles" after system power cycle
content:
Desktop running Windows 10, 64 bit installation. Recently after power cycling my PC both Firefox Version 113.0.2 and Thunderbird Version 102.11.2 when launched, indicate that they have never been set up. Each programs respective Profile "????????.default" directory contain an additional file named "Invalidprefs.js". Each time this occurs, I can resolve it by erasing the entire contents of the "????????.default" directory and copy the entire contents of a good profile directory from an earlier backup. This issue started happening around the second week of May. I have been using both Firefox and Thunderbird for about 20 years and never had an issue. It appears to be related to the recent updates that where released.

I have had Firefox Version 113.0.2 running on my laptop which has Windows 11, 64 bit without issue. I installed Thunderbird Version 102.11.2 onto this laptop to see if it had the same issue as the Windows 10 desktop system. So far it works just fine.

Please let me know if you need additional information. I do not want want to run Thunderbird on my laptop permanently. I have considered downgrading Firefox to Version 112.0.2 and Thunderbird to 102.10.1 on the desktop. Rather not go though the extra work to downgrade if I don't have to.

Thank you
creator: draket

title: automatically forward all mails with attachment (and do not attach as an inline attachement)
content:
Hi all, how can I 1/ automatically forward mails 2/ in a way that attachments are NOT attached inline (even if they are incoming as inline)?

We forward all accounting emails to the accounting software. The accounting software, a SaaS, filters out all incoming emails, which have attachements attached inline.

Thus, I would like to attach all attachements "normal", not inline. Even if the attachment was attached inline originally.

thanks a ton in advance tom
creator: tom23423

title: Turning message notifications in Thunderbird on and off
content: Hi there, I have a new Macbook which is running Ventura 13.4 as OS. I have installed Thunderbird 102.11.2. Both of these are latest versions. In System Settings, I cannot adjust the Notifications for Thunderbird - everything is switched on and I cannot change that (see first uploaded image). I have also tried the Settings pane in Thunderbird itself. Although I have unchecked all of the Notifications boxes (see second uploaded image), I continue to get all notifications - banners, alerts and sounds. I do not want all these things as it disturbs me while I am working. Am I doing something wrong or is there a bug in the system? On my previous Macbook I could control the Thunderbird notifications. Thanks, Greg

title: Cannot send mail message
content:
Good morning

Opening Thunderbird this morning, I saw 3400 messages in the Inbox all labelled "Cannot send mail"

These were deleted and I also looked on the CPanel to make sure the mailbox was full

Since then I am unable to send mail

I then downloaded eM client and using the same SMTP settings, was able to send mail

I backed up Thunderbird using Mozbackup, uninstalled Thunderbird, downloaded a new version (102.11.2) and restored the backup

The same problem persists

Is there perhaps a corrupt file in the Profiles folder causing this?

Thank you Regards Chris
